alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:49PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Big Horn, northeastern Carbon and south central Yellowstone Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 348 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Pryor, or 19 miles south of Billings, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pryor. This does not include Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
